title: ruby DoS https://www.mruby.science
content:
Hi,
When I sent 49000x "A" I was probably able to crash service running on https://www.mruby.science since new code can't be executed for now. Could you please verify what happened? Thanks.
steps: Send a request with 49000x 'A' characters to the service running on https://www.mruby.science.
Observe that the service crashes and new code can no longer be executed.
vuln_description: The vulnerability is a Denial of Service (DoS) issue where sending a large input (49000x 'A' characters) crashes the service, preventing it from executing new code.
reason: The attack is straightforward and involves sending a large payload to the service, which is a common and well-known method for triggering DoS conditions. There are no complex interactions or multiple components involved.
